title: Valid Parentheses
prompt:
Given a string s containing only the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', return true if the input string is valid.

A string is valid if:
- Open brackets are closed by the same type of brackets.
- Open brackets are closed in the correct order.
- Every close bracket has a corresponding open bracket of the same type.

Return a boolean.
constraintQuestions: Can the input be an empty string? (Yes, treat it as valid.)
Will the string contain only bracket characters? (Assume yes.)
Are there any other bracket types to consider beyond (), [], {}?
Do we need an O(n) time solution?
Should we use a stack to track the order of open brackets?

walkthrough.title: Stack insight
walkthrough.body:
We need to compare each closing bracket with the most recent unmatched opening bracket.
That is a classic LIFO order, which is exactly what a stack provides.
If we ever see a closing bracket that does not match the top of the stack, the string is invalid.
At the end, the stack must be empty.

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (stack implementation)
Complexity
walkthrough.body:
Time: O(n) because we scan the string once.
Space: O(n) in the worst case when all characters are opening brackets.
